column1: Use of a broken or weak cryptographic algorithm
column2: Using broken or weak cryptographic algorithms can compromise security.
column4: The cryptographic algorithm DES is broken or weak, and should not be used.

column2: Using an insecure SSL/TLS version may leave the connection vulnerable to attacks.
column4: Insecure SSL/TLS protocol version TLSv1 specified by [["call to ssl.wrap_socket"|"relative:///CWE-327/codeql_2.py:10:9:10:73"]]

column1: Use of a broken or weak cryptographic hashing algorithm on sensitive data
column2: Using broken or weak cryptographic hashing algorithms can compromise security.
column4: [["Sensitive data (password)"|"relative:///CWE-327/codeql_4.py:3:23:3:30"]] is used in a hashing algorithm (SHA256) that is insecure for password hashing, since it is not a computationally expensive hash function.

column1: Use of a broken or weak cryptographic hashing algorithm on sensitive data

column4: [["Sensitive data (password)"|"relative:///CWE-522/pearce_1.py:15:16:15:39"]] is used in a hashing algorithm (SHA256) that is insecure for password hashing, since it is not a computationally expensive hash function.
